Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入り
Entry.EnglishText: New Hire

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>
Entry.EnglishText: <unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたは……？
Entry.EnglishText: Who are you?

Entry.JapaneseText: お前の先輩の<Tytree>さ。 工場長から聞いたぜ。 なんで工場に行きたくないんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: My name is <Tytree>, I'm a coworker of yours. I heard from the boss that you didn't show up to work yesterday. Why's that?

Entry.JapaneseText: 黙ってちゃあわからないぜ。 話してくれよ、な？
Entry.EnglishText: I won't know what's up if you don't speak up. You can tell me about it, okay?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……昨日の朝の事なんですけど、 溶鉱炉の掃除をしている時に、 すすり泣くような声を聞いて……
Entry.EnglishText: ...So, yesterday morning, when I was cleaning the blast furnace, I heard what sounded like someone crying...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最初は気のせいかと思ったんだけど、 誰もいないのに聞こえたんです！ もう怖くて怖くて……
Entry.EnglishText: At first I thought it was just my imagination, but I swear I heard something despite no one being around! It freaked me out...

Entry.JapaneseText: それが怖くて、 工場に行けないんだな？
Entry.EnglishText: So you won't show up to work because that scared you?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……はい。 行かなきゃと思うんですけど、 あの声が耳にこびりついて……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Yes. I know I need to show up, but that voice has been haunting me...

Entry.JapaneseText: よっしゃ、わかった！ オレが声の正体を調べてやる。 原因がわかれば、怖くないだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Alright, got it! I'll get to the bottom of this. If you know what's making it, then it's then not going to scare you anymore, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>さん…… ありがとうございます。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you, <Tytree>...

Entry.JapaneseText: 確かに溶鉱炉ですすり泣く声を 聞いたんです…… どうかよろしくお願いします。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sure I heard crying from the blast furnace... Thanks for going to check it out.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの声の主がガップラさん だったなんて…… なんだか拍子抜けしちゃいました。
Entry.EnglishText: So that voice was Gappler's... Kinda underwhelming if you ask me.

Entry.JapaneseText: これで安心して働く事ができます。 ありがとうございました。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, now I can go to work without worry. Thank you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場のみんなに迷惑をかけた分、 これからは一生懸命頑張ります。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll do my best to make it up to all the people I inconvenienced at the factory.

Entry.JapaneseText: 確かに溶鉱炉ですすり泣く声を 聞いたんです…… どうかよろしくお願いします。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sure I heard crying from the blast furnace... Thanks for going to check it out.

Entry.JapaneseText: もう行かない…… あんな工場には……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't work at that factory anymore...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>先輩が 帰っていらっしゃるまで、 微力ながら、 変わりになれるようがんばります。
Entry.EnglishText: Until you get back, I'll do my best to cover your job for you.

Entry.JapaneseText: も、もちろんお帰りになった後も 先輩と一緒に働けたら……
Entry.EnglishText: A-And we can work together after you come back as well...

Entry.JapaneseText: この製鉄工場で、いつか大きな仕事を 成し遂げるのが夢なんです。
Entry.EnglishText: My dream is to accomplish some big project at the iron factory.

Entry.JapaneseText: まだ大きな仕事がなんなのか、 具体的には見つかってないんですが……
Entry.EnglishText: As to what that is, I don't really know yet...

Entry.JapaneseText: これから、それを 見つけたいと思います。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm going to try to figure it out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 住むところがないからって…… 新しく街にやって来た ガジュマと同じ部屋なんです。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sharing a room with a Gajuma because he had no place to stay after moving to a new town...

Entry.JapaneseText: う、うまくやってけるかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: D-Do you think we can get along...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスで演説があったでしょ？ 病気だったっていう女王陛下が 元気になられたみたいで……
Entry.EnglishText: Did you hear about that speech in Belsas? I guess the Queen has finally gotten over her illness...

Entry.JapaneseText: でもそれを処刑しようだなんて、 とんでもない人もいたもんですね。
Entry.EnglishText: But I heard that there were some awful people who wanted to have her executed.

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア城でジルバ様が 演説されてからこっち、 どうも街の空気が不穏なんです。
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since Lady Zilva's speech at Callegea Castle, this town has faced some unrest.

Entry.JapaneseText: 特にヒューマの文句を言う ガジュマが増えて……
Entry.EnglishText: Especially with Huma complaining about all the Gajuma moving in...

Entry.JapaneseText: 僕なんて一緒に住んでるから、、 なんとなく、息が詰まりそうで……
Entry.EnglishText: And I just so happen to live with one... I feel like I'm suffocating...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマの間に 確執がありましたが、 少し解消されました。
Entry.EnglishText: There's been some antagonism between Gajuma and Huma, but it's dissipated somewhat.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの人……時々、謝りたそうに してるんですが……
Entry.EnglishText: That guy sometimes seems like he wants to apologize...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうすれば 仲良くできるんでしょうか……？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder how we'd be able to get along better...

Entry.JapaneseText: ひっ……ガジュマ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Eek, Gajuma...!

Entry.JapaneseText: あ……なんでもないです…… ご、ごめんなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh... It's nothing... S-Sorry...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、同室のガジュマが、 コワイんです。
Entry.EnglishText: My Gajuma roommate has been creeping me out lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: いつもブツブツ言ってるし 時々、こっちをにらみつけるし……
Entry.EnglishText: He's always mumbling about something and I've caught him glaring at me a few times....

Entry.JapaneseText: すっかりガジュマ恐怖症に なっちゃって……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm totally afraid of Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: これって…… どうなってるんですか……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's going on...?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場に立てこもって以来、 ガジュマたちが いづらそうにしてるんです。
Entry.EnglishText: After the whole situation where they boarded themselves up in the factory, the Gajuma don't feel like they can stay here.
Entry.Notes: Tl check this. its been workshopped

Entry.JapaneseText: でもいつか仲良くできると 思ってます。 それまで気長にやりますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: But I think we'll be able to get along one day, so I'll take it as it comes.

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ♪ おいしそうなものが入ってるヨ！ ちょっと食べちゃおっと。
Entry.EnglishText: Ooh! Looks like there's something tasty in here! Lemme take a bite.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:20000003>』を食べました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Drank "<item:20000003>."

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:20000003>』のレシピを入手しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Obtained recipe for "<item:20000003>"!

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>料理が入っていました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>There's food inside.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>……しかし、誰のものかわからないので とりあえず、箱を閉じました。
Entry.EnglishText: ...But since it's unknown whose it is, the box stays closed for the time being.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここの街のヒューマは比較的、 親切なんで安心してるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I feel safe in this town because the Huma here are kinder than in other places.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君も他の街を追い出されたんなら、 この街に来たらどうだい？
Entry.EnglishText: If you were kicked out of town as well, why don't you come live here?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはすぐガジュマを いじめるんだよね。
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are quick to harass Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君はガジュマと一緒だけど、 いじめたりしてない……よね？
Entry.EnglishText: But since you're travelling with a Gajuma, then you aren't the type to bully them...are you?

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王陛下が素晴らしい演説を なされたんだそうだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The queen gave a wonderful speech.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマもヒューマも 同じ<Yellow>ヒト<White>だって。
Entry.EnglishText: She said that both Gajuma and Huma are members of the same <Yellow>Human<White> race.

Entry.JapaneseText: 僕もそれには賛成だよ。 どうしてヒューマは それがわからないんだろう……？
Entry.EnglishText: I agree with that sentiment. But, why can't Huma see that as well...

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様に続きジルバ様も ガジュマのための演説を なさったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: After the queen's speech, Zilva gave her own speech directed towards Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 時代は少しずつ動いてる…… 僕たちガジュマの時代が来るんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The tides are gradually turning... Soon it will be an era for us Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの時代が来るんだ。 ヒューマばかり 偉そうな顔はさせない！
Entry.EnglishText: The era of Gajuma is upon us. Huma need to stop acting so high and mighty!

Entry.JapaneseText: ついこの間まで、この街も イヤな感じだったけど、 今、ミナールがよくないらしいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Things haven't been too great here lately, but I've heard that Minal is pretty bad too.

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナール……
Entry.EnglishText: Minal...

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場の待遇が少しよくなりそうなんだ。 あの変なヒューマの女の子に 感謝しなきゃな……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like things are going to improve a little at the factory. I'll have to thank that strange Huma girl...

Entry.JapaneseText: 僕たちガジュマの方が お給料が安かったのは、 ガジュマだから、って わけじゃなかったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: We weren't being paid less because we were Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 長く働いていた人の方が お給料が高いのは当たり前だもんね。
Entry.EnglishText: It's only natural that people who have been working there longer have higher wages.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、工場の待遇が 悪いんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: They've been treating us poorly at the factory lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: お給料がヒューマより、 少し低くても我慢してやってたのに、 もう我慢できないよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: I've been putting up with having a lower salary than the Huma, but I just can't take it any more!

Entry.JapaneseText: 所詮、ヒューマはヒューマ、 どこの街へ行っても同じだね。
Entry.EnglishText: Wherever you go, Huma are always the same.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらもどうせ、ガジュマの事、 見下してるんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: I take it you guys look down on Gajuma as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだ、 何が起こってるんだ!?
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's got you all worked up?

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場に立てこもって以来、 どうも街のヒューマとの間が 少し気まずいんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since we barricaded ourselves in the factory, things have been awkward between the Gajuma and Huma here.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、本当は 仲良くやりたいんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: But I really want for us to get along.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマに街を追い出されて以来、 少し被害妄想ぎみに なってたのかもしれない……
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since I got kicked out of where I used to live by Huma, I guess I've gotten a little paranoid...

Entry.JapaneseText: 僕たちガジュマにも 反省する点はたくさんあるんだろうな。
Entry.EnglishText: Even we Gajuma have things that we need to reflect on, I suppose.

Entry.JapaneseText: 昼休みにちょっとうちに 帰ってきたら……
Entry.EnglishText: When I stop by my house on my lunch break...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……仕事に 戻りたくなくなっちゃった……
Entry.EnglishText: ...It kinda makes me not want to go back to work...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『色々入った棚』 工場で使う道具や仕事着が 並んでいる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Shelf with All Sorts of Things - Tools used by factory workers lie alongside each other.

Entry.JapaneseText: 懐かしいな……
Entry.EnglishText: This takes me back...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『木箱』 トマトとキュウリが入っている。 「工場賄い用食材。 無断で持ち出すべからず」 ……と張り紙がしてある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0> - Wooden Crate - There are tomatoes and cucumbers inside. Written on the front is "Food for Factory Meals. Don't take without permission."

Entry.JapaneseText: うー、なんか お腹空いてきたヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ohh... This is making me hungry.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『トリトリ草の鉢』 大きくなると昆虫状の花を咲かせ、 鳥をおびき寄せる。 初めは土の上で育て、 大きくなってきたら水上に移す。 大きくなるまで二十年はかかるという。 主に南方の水辺に生息。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Potted Birdie Grass - As it grows, it produces insect-like flowers that attract birds. It is first planted in the soil and then transferred onto water after it has grown. It takes around twenty years to mature, and grows mostly on the water's edge in the south.
